p: Apart from this, other modifications such as thermal stability management, reusability, self-sanitising ability, were also investigated. A novel system of nanofibre/nanoporous polyethylene (fibre/nanoPE), which showed high particulate matter adhesion and capture efficiency was developed [ 107]. Thermal management aims to enhance/suppress radiative dissipation in a high/low-temperature environment. This material showed an excellent radiative cooling effect owing to the high transmission dispersal of the human body temperature (2.1% for nanoPE, 89.3% for fibre/nanoPE). Incorporating a layer of Ag accommodated the heat loss in low temperatures. The IR transmittance rates were much higher when compared to commercially available masks ( Figure 12a). Figure 12b gives the thermal mapping of the human face indicating the temperatures.
